text: Keg at borefts. Pours deep orange, nose is floral, pine, caramel, taste is honey, orange, zesty.
On tap @ BBF 2016. Cloudy orange with a tiny off white head. Fruity and flowery tones. Malt, fruit, spices and hops. Medium body with a dry / fruity finish.

(Draught at Jopen Proeflokaal, Amsterdam, 29 Aug 2015) Dark red colour with brief, foamy head. Malty, fruity nose with notes of red berries, caramel, juniper twigs and a slight sourness. Malty, fruity taste with red fruit, lingonberries, caramel, a light tartness and a slightly sweet and sour finish. Medium body, with a certain sweetness. Hardly any bitterness. Interesting and quite refreshing. Quite nice.

On tap at Jopen Proeflokaal Amsterdam. Clear, brownish amber with no head. Sweetish-malty aroma of raisins, cinnamon, brown sugar and dates. Sweetish-malty taste of dates, prunes, strawberry jam and brown sugar, followed by a short, slightly sourish and minimally vinous finish. Thin to medium body, slightly oily mouthfeel, flat. Interesting at least, very unusual beer. More of a sipper, quite tasty actually. Nice tick of course!
Glass at Jopen amsterdam, copper orange beer, almost no head, aroma is sour, fruit, juniper. Taste is the same, quite dry after taste
Aroma of red fruits, sourish berries, "Roosvicee", soft malt. Flavour is light to moderate sour. Not as wild as I had hoped.

Tap at Jopen Amsterdam. Dark amber color, tiny white head. Funky blue cheese and berryish aroma. Light-bodied. Suprisingly taste is not so wild. It is like watered down sahti with juniper flavor and light banana plus some citric extra. Like "small sahti". I still prefer traditional ones.
A bit lacking. Poured a murky reddish brown with a tan ring. Aroma of light funk and soft malt. Light body, flavour is lightly sweet, lightly funky.
Draft @ Brett Fest 2015. Purple velvet color. Aroma of sour berries. Taste is fresh, with sourness, berries and some herbs. Interesting, but a bit thin.
Tap @ Jopen Haarlem. Murky brown color. Vinous notes, red berries amd acetone in the aroma and flavor. A quite moderate plummy sourness. A unique beer.

Draft at Jopen Amsterdam during Carnival Brettanomyces 2015. Pours cloudy brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of vegetables, light funk, malt and caramel. Flavour is light moderate sweet. Thin watery bodied with flat carbonation.
